SENT.plain: Summary: Here, we present a 32-year-old male with proptosis and chemosis of the left eye following a close head injury
Digital subtraction angiography of the left internal carotid artery showed a left carotid-cavernous fistula (CCF) associated with a primitive trigeminal artery (PTA) variant
The patient was successfully treated with transvenous Guglielmi detachable coils embolization via the inferior petrosal sinus
The PTA variant was preserved without cerebellar or brainstem infarct
